data.title: Sound Advice: Recently Released
data.meta_description: List of upcoming theatrical releases on CD, VHS, and DVD.
data.text:
Recently Released

Also See Upcoming Release Schedule

Updated 7/16/24 Most Recently Released | 2022 | 2021 | 2020 | 2019 | 2018 | 2017 | 2016 | 2015 | 2014 | 2013 | 2012 | 2011 | 2010 | 2009 | 2008 |2007 | 2006 | 2005 | 2004 | 2003 | 2002 |

Judy Garland - The Alternate "Judy" Album

(HDTT - new on CD)

First release of never-before-heard alternate takes of songs on Judy Garland's 1956 Capitol album "Judy." Also included: complete restored soundtrack from the April 8, 1956, CBS special episode of "General Electric Theatre" series for the album release hosted by Ronald Reagan. From acetate discs. HighDefTapeTransfers.ca

Ladyship the Musical (Original Concept Recording)

(Whirligig Records - new digital album)

Score by Laura Good and Linda Good. Cast includes Maddie Shea Baldwin, Lisa Karlin, Savannah Frazier, Brandi Knox, Annie Sherman, and Trevor St. John-Gilbert, featuring Quentin Oliver Lee. Produced by Laura Good and Linda Good, mixed by Jakob Reinhardt. Bandcamp.com.

The Outsiders

(Sony Masterworks Broadway - new on CD)

2024 OBC recording of score by Jamestown Revival and Justin Levine (the book is by Adam Rapp with Justin Levine). Three tracks released early. Cast includes Brody Grant, Sky Lakota-Lynch, Joshua Boone, Brent Comer, Jason Schmidt, Emma Pittman, Daryl Tofa, Kevin William Paul, and Dan Berry. Released earlier in digital format

Parting Gift: The Songs of Gerald Ginsburg

(PS Classics - new on CD)

World Premiere recordings of lost treasures by composer Gerald Ginsburg (1932-2019). Two dozen musical settings of poetry by such luminaries as W. B. Yeats, Edna St. Vincent Millay, and E. E. Cummings. Shereen Ahmed, Mikaela Bennett, Philip Chaffin, Will Chase, Victoria Clark, Jason Danieley, Adrienne Danrich, Jordan Donica, Colin Donnell, Telly Leung, Paul Lincoln, Patti Murin, Kelli O'Hara, Elena Shaddow, Nathaniel Stampley, Elizabeth Stanley, and Lauren Worsham. Orchestrated by Jonathan Tunick, Doug Besterman, Larry Hochman, Michael Starobin, Chris Jahnke, and John Baxindine, among others, and performed by an orchestra of 17 under the baton of Richard Carsey. Produced by Tommy Krasker and Bart Migal. Digital released 6/21/24. PSClassics.com.

Titanic

(Stage2View - new Blu-ray/DVD)

Filmed musical, with a score by Maury Yeston, that was shown in cinemas. Now streaming at BroadwayHD, to be available for global streaming 8/1/24, and released in physical format sometime in 2024 with Liberator Films and MVD Entertainment Group.

Week of July 2, 2024

Folk City: The Greenwich Village Musical

(JAY Records - new digital album)

Original studio album in DigiMix. Music by Ronnie DAddario, Nick Lohri, Lili Añel, Paula Brion, Pat DiNizio, Tracy Nelson, Gary English, Morgan Mallory, Abby Dormer, George Papas, Robbie Woliver, Emma Woliver, Filippo De Laura. Lyrics by Robbie Woliver (book by Bernadette Contreras and Robbie Woliver). Vocals by Judah Frank, Morgan Mallory, Abby Dormer, Paula Brion, Emily Blount, R.O. Shapiro, George Papas, Pat DiNizio. 84-page booklet with liner notes, full lyrics, and scene descriptions, bios of the cast and songwriters, credits, 60+ photos and more. 30 tracks. Released 4/5/24. Pat Di Nizio Double CD expected in September. JAYRecords.com.

In Pieces: A New Musical Highlights Album

(Broadway Records - new digital album)

Score by Joey Contreras. New release includes eight never-before released tracks, in addition to the 2021 cast recording.

A Sense of Theatre: The Untold Stories of the Creation of Britain's National Theatre

(Unicorn Publishing Group - Hardcover Book)

By Richard Pilbrow (British pioneer of stage lighting; appointed by Sir Laurence Olivier to help create the National Theatre of Great Britain as a member of the building committee). An eye-witness account of the birth and subsequent triumph of one of the world's most famous theatres. The theatre architecture has challenged generations of theatre makers, leading to innovation that has changed theatre worldwide. With insight from leading players in British theatre and the minutes of the deliberations between Sir Laurence, architect and leading theatre artists. 528 pages.

Schwartz Songs

(Westway Music - new on CD)

New recordings of songs by Stephen Schwartz. With Samantha Barks, Jamie Muscato, Lucie Jones, Louise Dearman, Kerry Ellis, Rachel Tucker, Billy Luke Nevers, John Owen-Jones, Oliver Thompsett, Rob Houchen, Hiba Elchikhe, Alice Fearn, Rachel John, Peter Jöback And Emma Kingston. "Defying Gravity," "Corner of the Sky," "Ain't It Good," "On Wings of a Swan," "Colours of the Wind," "Let There Be," "The Wizard and I," "On the Willows," "Meadowlark," "Deliver Us," "Beautiful City," "Forgiveness Embrace," "Lost in the Wilderness," "Oh, Bless the Lord My Soul," "Children of the Wind," "When You Believe." Conceived and produced by Rhydian Roberts and Stephen Schwartz. Digital released 6/28/24.

Week of June 25, 2024

The Great Gatsby

(Sony Masterworks Broadway - new digital album)

OBC recording of score by Jason Howland and Nathan Tysen (book by Kait Kerrigan). Cast includes Jeremy Jordan, Eva Noblezada, Noah J. Ricketts, Samantha Pauly, Sara Chase, John Zdrojeski, Paul Whitty, and Eric Anderson. "Roaring On," "Absolute Rose," "New Money," "For Her," "Valley of Ashes," "Second-Hand Suit," "For Better or Worse," "The Met," "Only Tea," "My Green Light," "Shady," "Better Hold Tight," "Past is Catching Up to Me," "La Dee Dah With You," "Go," "Made to Last," "For Better or Worse (Reprise)," "One-Way Road," "God Sees Everything," "For Her (Reprise)," "New Money (Reprise)," "Beautiful Little Fool," "Made to Last," "For Better or Worse (Reprise)," "One-Way Road," "God Sees Everything," "For Her (Reprise)," "New Money (Reprise)," "Beautiful Little Fool," "Finale: Roaring On." CD to be released 8/2/24.

Jeremy Pope: Last Name Pope

(new EP)

Tony-nominated Jeremy Pope (Choir Boy, Ain't Too Proud) with six original songs. "U, Lost," "What I Gotta Do," "Want, U," "City2City," "Fine," "U, Lost (Prom Edition)." Written and produced by Jeremy Pope. Released 6/21/24.

Schwartz Songs

(Westway Music - new digital album)

New recordings of songs by Stephen Schwartz. With Samantha Barks, Jamie Muscato, Lucie Jones, Louise Dearman, Kerry Ellis, Rachel Tucker, Billy Luke Nevers, John Owen-Jones, Oliver Thompsett, Rob Houchen, Hiba Elchikhe, Alice Fearn, Rachel John, Peter Jöback And Emma Kingston. "Defying Gravity," "Corner of the Sky," "Ain't It Good," "On Wings of a Swan," "Colours of the Wind," "Let There Be," "The Wizard and I," "On the Willows," "Meadowlark," "Deliver Us," "Beautiful City," "Forgiveness Embrace," "Lost in the Wilderness," "Oh, Bless the Lord My Soul," "Children of the Wind," "When You Believe." Conceived and produced by Rhydian Roberts and Stephen Schwartz. CD to be released 7/5/24.

Yankee Doodle Dandy: George M. Cohan and the Broadway Stage

(Oxford Univ Press - Hardcover Book)

By Elizabeth T. Craft. Part of the Broadway Legacies series. In the first book on Cohan in fifty years, Craft situates Cohan as a central figure of his day. Examining his multifaceted contributions and the various sociocultural identities he came to embody, Craft shows how Cohan and his works indelibly shaped the American cultural landscape. 288 pages.

Week of June 18, 2024

The Connector

(Concord Theatricals - new album)

World premiere Off-Broadway cast recording of score by Jason Robert Brown (book by Jonathan Marc Sherman). Scott Bakula, Max Crumm, Hannah Cruz, Ashley Pérez Flanagan, Danielle Lee Greaves, Mylinda Hull, Daniel Jenkins, Jessica Molaskey, Fergie Philippe, Eliseo Román, Ben Levi Ross, Ann Sanders, and Michael Winther. Spring 2024 release expected. Recorded week of 2/14/24 at The DiMenna Center for Classical Music. Produced by Jeffrey Lesser and Brown, who also serves as arranger, orchestrator, and pianist. Tom Murray is the music director and Kristy Norter is the music coordinator. The band includes Brown, Jamie Eblen, Hidayat Honari, Adam Kaufman, Randy Landau, and Todd Reynolds.

Don't Compromise Yourself: The Very Best of Mary Bridget Davies

(Center Stage Records - new digital album)

Mary Bridget Davies performs songs by Jerry Ragovoy for Janis Joplin and selections By TJ Armand And Mark Berman Inspired By Virginia Woolf. "Don't Compromise Yourself," "Stay with Me / Cry Baby," "Piece of My Heart," "Get It While You Can," "As Long as I Have You," "Getting In My Way," "Own," "Before The Afterglow," "Why," "End Of All Roads," "Oh, Mother," "You Must Make It," "Freedom Of My Mind," "As Long As I Have You," "Stay With Me," "The Right Of Way," "Don't Compromise Yourself," "Master Of Disguise," "Move Me No Mountain," "Getting In My Way." Recorded at Power Station NYC.

From The Back of the House: Memoir of a Broadway Theatre Manager

(Ibis Books - new Kindle Edition)

Memoir by Broadway theater manager Dan Landon. Spanning from 1978-2018, the book shares backstage and onstage stories of encounters with theatre luminaries such as Bob Fosse, Ian McKellen, Bernadette Peters, August Wilson, Maggie Smith, Judi Dench, Mikhail Baryshnikov, Madeline Kahn, Stephen Sondheim, Tom Stoppard, David Mamet, and more.

The Heart of Rock and Roll

(Joy Machine Records new digital album)

OBC recording of score from the new musical inspired by the songs of Huey Lewis and The News. Cast includes Corey Cott, McKenzie Kurtz, Josh Breckenridge, John Dossett, F. Michael Haynie, Zoe Jensen, Tamika Lawrence, Raymond J. Lee, John-Michael Lyles, Orville Mendoza, Billy Harrigan. "Overture/Bobby's Daydream," "Hip to Be Square," "Be Someone," "Don't Make Me Do It," "Workin' for a Livin'," "I Know What I Like," "It's All Right (Preprise)," "I Never Walk Alone/Finally Found a Home," "That's Not Me," "Give Me the Keys (And I'll Drive You Crazy)," "The Pitch," "Do You Believe in Love," "The Heart of Rock and Roll," "Entr'acte," "The Heart of Rock and Roll Band & Huey Lewis," "You Crack Me Up," "It's All Right," "I Want a New Drug," "Doing It All for My Baby," "Stuck With You," "It Hit Me Like a Hammer," "Back in Time," "The Only One," "Perfect World," "Be Someone (Reprise)," "If This Is It," "Giving It All up for Love," "The Power of Love." Mixed and engineered by Derik Lee. Mastered by Oscar Zambrano. Produced by Huey Lewis, Brian Usifer and Will Van Dyke with Hunter Arnold, Tyler Mitchell and Kayla Greenspan serving as Executive Producers.

Illinoise: A New Musical

(Nonesuch - new on CD)

Original cast recording of score by Sufjan Stevens (book by Justin Peck & Jackie Sibblies Drury). Arrangements and orchestrations by Timo Andres. 14-piece on-stage band: Elijah Lyons, Shara Nova, Tasha Viets-VanLear, Christina Courtin, Sean Peter Forte, Domenica Fossati, Daniel Freedman, Kathy Halvorson, Nathan Koci, Eleonore Oppenheim, Brett Parnell, Brandon Ridenour, Kyra Sims, and Jessica Tsang. "Chicago (Reprise)" and "The Predatory Wasp of the Palisades is Out to Get Us!" now available. Produced by Dean Sharenow, Timo Andres, Nathan Koci, Garth MacAleavey, and executive produced by Orin Wolf and Nate Koch. Edited, mixed, and mastered by Dean Sharenow at Steel Cut Audio and Garth MacAleavey served as recording engineer. Digital released 5/31/24. Vinyl to be released 8/20/24.

Lempicka

(Sony Masterworks Broadway - new digital album)

OBC recording of score by Matt Gould and Carson Kreitzer. Eden Espinosa, George Abud, Amber Iman, Natalie Joy Johnson, Zoe Glick, Nathaniel Stampley, and Beth Leavel. Released 5/29/24. CD to be released 7/5/24.

Parting Gift: The Songs of Gerald Ginsburg

(PS Classics - new digital)

World Premiere recordings of lost treasures by composer Gerald Ginsburg (1932-2019). Two dozen musical settings of poetry by such luminaries as W. B. Yeats, Edna St. Vincent Millay, and E. E. Cummings. Shereen Ahmed, Mikaela Bennett, Philip Chaffin, Will Chase, Victoria Clark, Jason Danieley, Adrienne Danrich, Jordan Donica, Colin Donnell, Telly Leung, Paul Lincoln, Patti Murin, Kelli O'Hara, Elena Shaddow, Nathaniel Stampley, Elizabeth Stanley, and Lauren Worsham. Orchestrated by Jonathan Tunick, Doug Besterman, Larry Hochman, Michael Starobin, Chris Jahnke, and John Baxindine, among others, and performed by an orchestra of 17 under the baton of Richard Carsey. Produced by Tommy Krasker and Bart Migal. PSClassics.com.

Week of June 11, 2024

Ballplayers on Stage: Baseball, Melodrama, and Theatrical Celebrity in the Deadball Era

(Univ of Tennessee Press - Hardcover Book)

By Travis Stern. Explores the relationship between professional baseball and professional theater in the late nineteenth and early twentieth centuries. Examines case studies of five representative players from baseball's preBabe Ruth deadball era: Cap Anson, Mike King Kelly, Christy Mathewson, Ty Cobb, and Rube Waddell, with a concluding study of Babe Ruth himself. A historical study of baseball, theater, and the relationship between the two ... also shares insight into the creation of celebrity in early twentieth-century America. 248 pages.

On This Side of the World

(new digital album)

East West Players world premiere recording of score by Paulo K Tiról (book by Noam Shapiro). Steven-Adam Agdeppa, Zandi De Jesus, Michael C. Palma (2), Cassie Simone, Andrea Somera, Shaun Tuazon. BandCamp.com.

Stereophonic

(Sony Masterworks Broadway - new on CD)

OBC recording of score featuring original songs by Will Butler. Will Brill, Andrew R. Butler, Juliana Canfield, Eli Gelb, Tom Pecinka, Sarah Pidgeon, and Chris Stack. Produced by Playwrights Horizons. "Seven Roads," "Bright v1," "Masquerade," "Bright (Fast)," "Drive," "Champagne," "East of Eden," "Domino," It's made of teak, "In Your Arms," "BVs," "Exorcist II," "Campfire Masquerade," "Bright (Take 22)." Digital version released 5/10/24.

Then, Now and Next (Original London Cast Recording)

(new digital album)

Southwark Playhouse cast recording of score by Christopher J Orton and Jon Robyns. Tori Allen-Martin (4), Justin Brett, Alice Fearn (8), Peter Hannah, Joaquin Pedro Valdes.

The Wiz

(Immersive/Interscope - new album)

2024 Broadway revival cast recording of score by Charlie Smalls (and others). Cast includes Nichelle Lewis, Wayne Brady, Deborah Cox, Melody A. Betts, Kyle Ramar Freeman, Phillip Johnson Richardson, and Avery Wilson. "Overture/Soon as I Get Home (Preprise)," "The Feeling We Once Had," "The Tornado," "He's the Wizard," "Soon as I Get Home," "You Can't Win," "Slide Some Oil to Me," "Mean Ole Lion," "Ease on Down the Road," "Be a Lion," "Meet the Wizard," "What Would I Do If I Could Feel," "We're Gonna Make It," "Don't Nobody Bring Me No Bad News," "Wonder, Wonder Why," "Everybody Rejoice/Brand New Day," "Y'All Got It," "Ease on Down the Road (Reprise)," "Believe in Yourself," "Home."

Weeks of May 28 - June 4, 2024

Antonio Adolfo: Love Cole Porter

(AAM Music - new digital album)

Brazilian pianist and composer Antonio Adolfo. Accompanied by Lula Galvao (guitar), Jorge Helder (double bass), Rafael Barata (drums), Dada Costa And Rafael Barata (percussion), Jesse Sadoc (trumpet, flugelhorn), Danilo Sinna (alto sax), Marcelo Martins (tenor and soprano sax, flute), And Rafael Rocha (trombone). "Easy to Love," "Ev'ry Time We Say Goodbye," "I Concentrate on You," "I Love You," "I've Got You Under My Skin," "Easy to Love," "Ev'ry Time We Say Goodbye," "I Concentrate on You," "I Love You," "I've Got You Under My Skin," "Just One of Those Things," "Love for Sale," "Night and Day," "So in Love," "You Do Something to Me.

Ben Platt: Honeymind

(Interscope - new on CD/digital/vinyl)

To include songs written with songwriters Hillary Lindsey, Natalie Hemby, and Alex Hope. "Right Kind Of Reckless," "All American Queen," "Andrew," "Before I Knew You," "Cherry On Top," "Treehouse," "Fear Of Missing Out," "Shoe To Drop," "Honeymind," "Home Of The Terrified," "Need You Like This," "Boy Who Hung The Moon," "Monsters." Executive producer Dave Cobb. Released 5/31/24.

The Colors of My Life: A Cy Coleman Songbook

(Club44 - new on CD/digial)

Vocalist Janis Siegel and pianist, arranger, and composer Yaron Gershovsky. "I've Got Your Number," "With Every Breath I Take," "Playboy's Theme," "Witchcraft," "That's My Style," "Being Without You," "The Best Is Yet to Come," "I'm Gonna Laugh You Right Out of My Life," "Why Try to Change Me Now," "The Colors of My Life."

Closer than Ever: The Unique Six-Decade Songwriting Partnership of Richard Maltby Jr. and David Shire

(Oxford Univ Press - Hardcover Book)

By Joshua Rosenblum. Chronicles the sixty-six-year (and counting) partnership of Richard Maltby Jr. and David Shire, with behind-the-scenes accounts of their musicals interspersed with analyses of standout individual numbers. 304 pages.

The Gospel According to Heather

(JAY Records - new on CD)

2023 Off-Broadway cast recording of score by Paul Gordon. Cast includes Lauren Elder, Badia Farha, Maria Habeeb, Jeremy Kushnier, Maya Lagerstam, Zach Rand, Katey Sagal, Carson Stewart, Brittany Nicole Williams, and Wayne Wilson. "My Name Is Heather Krebs," "The Weight of My Burden," "Wait," "Risen," "Conventional," "Don't Go Spreading Rumours," "The Healing," "Reckoning," "St Heather," "Just a GirlBreaking News," "She Has on Sneakers," "Up All Night," "Spread a Little Light," "Don't Tell Mom," "My Name is Heather Kreb (Reprise)," "Penny In My Pocket," "Raise Your Hand," "Raise Your Hand (reprise)." Produced by John Yap. Digital released 2/16/24.

Hell's Kitchen

(Alicia Keys Records - new digital album)

OBC recording of score by Alicia Keys (book by Kristoffer Diaz). Cast includes Maleah Joi Moon, Shoshana Bean, Brandon Victor Dixon, Chris Lee, Kecia Lewis.

Illinoise: A New Musical

(Nonesuch - new digital album)

Original cast recording of score by Sufjan Stevens (book by Justin Peck & Jackie Sibblies Drury). Arrangements and orchestrations by Timo Andres. 14-piece on-stage band: Elijah Lyons, Shara Nova, Tasha Viets-VanLear, Christina Courtin, Sean Peter Forte, Domenica Fossati, Daniel Freedman, Kathy Halvorson, Nathan Koci, Eleonore Oppenheim, Brett Parnell, Brandon Ridenour, Kyra Sims, and Jessica Tsang. "Chicago (Reprise)" and "The Predatory Wasp of the Palisades is Out to Get Us!" now available. Produced by Dean Sharenow, Timo Andres, Nathan Koci, Garth MacAleavey, and executive produced by Orin Wolf and Nate Koch. Edited, mixed, and mastered by Dean Sharenow at Steel Cut Audio and Garth MacAleavey served as recording engineer. Released 5/31/24.

Jocelyn Bioh: Three Plays: Merry Wives; Nollywood Dreams; School Girls, Or, The African Mean Girls Play

(Methuen Drama - Paperback Book/Kindle Edition)

First collection of plays from American contemporary playwright Jocelyn Bioh. 216 pages. Released 5/30/24.

Mike Bartlett

(Routledge - Hardcover/Paperback/Kindle Edition)

By William C. Boles. Routledge Modern and Contemporary Dramatists series editors Maggie Gale and Graham Saunders. Includes Barlett's plays Cock, Doctor Foster, King Charles III, and Albion, a biographical introductory chapter, and new interviews with Bartlett and some of his closest and oft relied upon collaborators. 186 pages.

My Favorite Things: The Rodgers & Hammerstein 80th Anniversary Concert

(Concord Recordings - new on 2 CDs/Digital)

Live Concert recording. Released at the time of the condensed version of the filmed concert premiere on PBS "Great Performances." Cast includes Joanna Ampil, Michael Ball, Daniel Dae Kim, Maria Friedman, Audra McDonald, Julian Ovenden, Lucy St. Louis, Aaron Tveit, Marisha Wallace, Patrick Wilson. 40-piece Rodgers & Hammerstein Concert Orchestra conducted by music supervisor Simon Lee. 42 tracks. Released 5/31/24.>

My Favorite Things: The Rodgers & Hammerstein 80th Anniversary Concert

(Liberator Films - new on Blu-ray/DVD)

Concert filmed at Theatre Royal Drury Lane, with songs from The Sound of Music, Carousel, South Pacific, and Oklahoma! Starring Joanna Ampil, Michael Ball, Maria Friedman, Daniel Dae Kim, Audra McDonald, Julian Ovenden, Lucy St. Louis, Aaron Tveit, Marisha Wallace and Patrick Wilson and featuring a 40-piece orchestra. Two hours.

Rarities from the Hollywood Studios 1933-1958

(Sepia Records - new on 2 CDs)

Previously unavailable tracks taken from studio playback and movie exploitation discs or alternative versions from 1933 to 1958, spanning 25 years of Bing Crosby's career. 30 tracks.

Suffs

(Atlantic Records - new digital album)

2022 Public Theater cast recording of score by Shaina Taub. Jenna Bainbridge, Ally Bonino, Tsilala Brock, Jenn Colella, Hannah Cruz, Nadia Dandashi, Aisha de Haas, Amina Faye, Holly Gould, Cassondra James, Nikki M. James, Jaygee Macapugay, Grace McLean, Susan Oliveras, Mia Pak, J. Riley Jr, Phillipa Soo, Shaina Taub, and Ada Westfall. "Let Mother Vote," "Finish the Fight," "Find a Way," "Wait My Turn," "Find a Way Coda," "Terrell's Theme," "The March (We Demand Equality)," "Great American Bitch," "Ladies," "A Meeting with President Wilson," "Worth It," "If We Were Married," "The Convention, Part I," "This Girl," "The Convention, Part II," "Alva Belmont," "Show Them Who You Are," "The Campaign," "How Long," "The Young Are at the Gates," "Respectfully Yours, Dudley Malone," "Hold It Together," "Wait My Turn (Reprise)," "The Report," "Show Them Who You Are (Reprise)," "Insane," "Fire & Tea," "Let Mother Vote (Reprise)," "She and I," "Down at the State House," "A Letter From Harry's Mother," "I Was Here," "If We Were Married (Reprise)," "August 26th, 1920," "Lucy's Song," "Ally Bonino," "Finish the Fight (Reprise)," "Keep Marching."

Texas Annie: The Legend of the Moan Ranger

(new digital album)

Concept album for Cincinnati, Ohio, Fringe Festival award winning musical with score by John Woods, Stephen Goers, Roz Mihalko, and Jenn Howd. "Sex Toys & Texas," "Dildos Are the Devil's Tools," "Swallow Your Destiny," "The Moan Ranger," "Learn to Love Yourself," "The Power of Pleasure," "Every BODY Is Divine," "The Second Coming."

Week of May 21, 2024

Christopher Oscar Peña: Three Plays: How To Make An American Son; The Strangers; A Cautionary Tail

(Methuen Drama - Hardcover Book/Paperback/Kindle Edition)

Edited by Mark Armstrong. Introduced by Hugh Dancy. The work of Latinx American playwright and screenwriter Christopher Oscar Peña. 456 pages.

Clyde's

(Theatre Communications Group - Paperback book/Kindle)

Play by Lynn Nottage. 96 pages.

The Group Theatre: An Enduring Legacy

(McFarland - Paperback Book/Kindle Edition)

By Mark Connelly. Examines the history and influence of the Group Theatre, which presented the first plays of Clifford Odets, Sidney Kingsley, and William Saroyan, and launched the careers of Franchot Tone, John Garfield, Elia Kazan, Lee J. Cobb, Karl Malden, Martin Ritt, and Luther Adler. 339 pages.

How to Find, Choose, and Prepare Successful Audition

(Methuen Drama - Hardcover Book/Paperback/Kindle Edition)

By Adam Wachter. Foreword by Rachel Hoffman. Afterword by Caissie Levy. Takes the reader step-by-step through the process of building your audition repertoire portfolio ... helps to identify what songs are needed in which categories and explains where to find them, how to source and cut the sheet music, and how to communicate effectively with the accompanist and act the song. 184 pages.

The Outsiders

(Sony Masterworks Broadway - new digital album)

2024 OBC recording of score by Jamestown Revival and Justin Levine (the book is by Adam Rapp with Justin Levine). Three tracks released early. Cast includes Brody Grant, Sky Lakota-Lynch, Joshua Boone, Brent Comer, Jason Schmidt, Emma Pittman, Daryl Tofa, Kevin William Paul, and Dan Berry. CD to be released June 28.

Tom Ball: Curtain Call

(Westway Music - new on CD)

Debut album from former Britain's Got Talent and "America's Got Talent" star Tom Ball. "Intro," "Writing's on the Wall," "Feeling Good," "The Best Part," "Stand By Me ft The Inner Voices," "Bring Him Home," "Goodbye ft Lucie Jones," "Let Me Live," "Can't Help Falling In Love," "Seize The Day," "Winter Song," "Home Again," "I (Who Have Nothing)."

Too Funny for Words: Backstage Tales from Broadway, Television, and the Movies

(Viva Editions - Paperback Book/Kindle Edition)

By Jerry Adler. The author recounts his career as a theater director, producer and actor that has spanned over 70 years. 240 pages.

Week of May 14, 2024

Becky Nurse of Salem: A Contemporary Comedy About a Historical Tragedy

(Theatre Communications Group - new Paperback Book)

Play by Sarah Ruhl. Played at Lincoln Center Theater in the fall of 2022. 112 pages.

Days of Wine and Roses

(Nonesuch - new on CD)

Original Off-Broadway (and Broadway) cast recording of score by Adam Guettel (book by Craig Lucas). Sharon Catherine Brown, Bill English, Olivia Hernandez, Brian d'Arcy James, Byron Jennings, David Jennings, Ted Koch, Ella Dane Morgan, Kelli O'Hara. "There Go I," "Evanesce," "Sammen I Himmeln," "As The Water Loves The Stone," "Are You Blue," "Underdeath," "First Breath," "435," "Morton Salt Girl," "Forgiveness," "Turlycue," "Forgiveness (Reprise)," "Lila Hangs The Moon," "There Go I (Reprise)." Recorded week of 7/24/23. Digital released 12/15/23.

FREE: Words on Music by a Hi-Def Critic in an MP3 World

(Bear Manor Media - Hardcover Book/Paperback)

By Lawrence Schulman ("Garland: Thats Beyond Entertainment  Reflections on Judy Garland"). Foreword by Tish Oney. Afterword by Manuel Betancourt. Schulman's writings between 2000 and 2024, on a whole host of artists and authors, including Peggy Lee, Frank Sinatra, Mildred Bailey, Patsy Cline, Bernard Herrmann, among others. 540 pages.

Gutenberg! The Musical!

(Center Stage Records/Yellow Sound Label - new on CD)

OBC recording of score by Scott Brown (music/lyrics) and Anthony King (lyrics). Josh Gad and Andrew Rannells. Recorded 1/29/24. Arrangements, and orchestrations are by T.O. Sterrett. Produced and mixed by Michael Croiter. BroadwayRecords.com. Digital released 5/3/24

Here We Are

(Concord Theatricals Recordings - on CD/digital)

Score by Stephen Sondheim (book by David Ives). Cast includes Francois Battiste, Tracie Bennett, Bobby Cannavale, Micaela Diamond, Amber Gray, Jin Ha, Rachel Bay Jones, Denis O'Hare, Steven Pasquale, David Hyde Pierce, and Jeremy Shamos. "Exit Music" now available. Recorded week of January 10, 2024. Produced by Sean Patrick Flahaven and Bill Rosenfield. 2-LP, 180g baby blue vinyl due on September 6.

Pulman & Stilgoe: A Couple of Swells

(new digital album)

Based on Liza Pulman and Joe Stilgoe's live act. "Steppin' Out With My Baby," "Harmony," "People Will Say We're in Love/If I Loved You," "That Was Then," "I Had Myself a True Love," "Mountain Greenery," "Close Your Eyes," "The Folks Who Live On the Hill," "Their Hearts Were Full of Spring," "Some Other Time."

Water for Elephants

(Ghostlight Records - new digital album)

OBC recording of score by PigPen Theatre Co. (book by Rick Elice). Two singles, "Wild" and "Silver Stars," now available. Cast includes Grant Gustin, Isabelle McCalla, Gregg Edelman, Paul Alexander Nolan, Stan Brown, Joe De Paul, Sara Gettelfinger, and Wade McCollum. Produced by Mary-Mitchell Campbell and Ian Kagey. "Anywhere/Another Train," "The Road Don't Make You Young," "Easy," "The Lion Has Got No Teeth," "I Choose The Ride," "Ode To An Elephant," "Just Our Luck," "I Shouldn't Be Surprised," "Silver Stars," "The Grand Spec," "Funny Angel," "Zostan," "Squeaky Wheel," "You've Got Nothing, Pt. 1," "You've Got Nothing, Pt. 2," "What Do You Do?," "Wild," "Go Home," "Finale (I Choose The Ride)."

Week of May 7, 2024

An Actor Convalescing in Devon

(Faber & Faber - Kindle Edition)

Play by Richard Nelson, which opened at Hampstead Theatre, London, in March 2024.

Ann Kittredge: Romantic Notions

(Jazzheads - new on CD/digital)

Singer Ann Kittredge's second album. On Bette Midler: An Opinionated Guide

(Oxford Univ Press - Hardcover Book)

By Kevin Winkler. Traces the early development of Midler's performing ethos from New York's downtown experimental theater scene and examines her impact across media, with chapters on the soaring highs (and occasional cringe-worthy lows) of her stage work, movies, recordings, and television appearances, and considers her influence as an environmental activist and social media presence. Features performance analysis and deeply researched background information, all supporting informed - and divinely opinionated - consideration of Midler the artist. 224 pages. Appears to be available ahead of publication date.

Peerless: Rouben Mamoulian, Hollywood, and Broadway

(Univ of Wisconsin Press - Hardcover Book/Kindle Edition)

By Kurt Jensen. Rouben Mamoulian, director of the original stage productions of Porgy and Bess, Carousel, and Oklahoma!, as well as films including Love Me Tonight, Queen Christina, City Streets, and Silk Stockings. Famously fired from the film version of Porgy and Bess in a dispute over publicity and quit Cleopatra after arguments over a single scene. Drawing upon Mamoulian's unfinished memoir and diaries, as well as interviews with surviving collaborators. Also explores Mamoulian's aesthetic principles and strategies as manifested in lighting, choreography, and sound design. 376 pages.

(Palgrave Macmillan - Hardcover Book/Kindle Edition)

By James F. Wilson. Explores the shifting representations of schoolteachers and professors in plays and performances primarily from the twentieth and twenty-first centuries in the United States.
